title: New England Stove
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
William Austin Kienbusch [1914-1980], New York, NY and Cranberry Island, ME; Kraushaar Galleries, New York, NY; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, August 1957 until April 8, 1958 [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1958 [2].

Notes:
[1]. In a letter to Gordon Washburn, dated August 13, 1957, Mrs. Beal wrote from Maine: "I have ordered the old painting (collage) by Kienbusch THE STOVE as a future gift to Carnegie Institute."
[2]. The work came to the museum first as a loan; it was gifted and accessioned on April 8, 1958.

creator.birth_place: New York City (New York state, United States)
